poem:
**Economic Momentum**

The whisper of numbers
through Wall Street corridors—
A pulse quickening,
stocks rising like dawn,
unexpected growth—
not a trembling hand
but a confident stride.
Nvidia quivers, 
fretful in the tempest;
yet, the economy, 
undeterred,
marches forward,
into the light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US stocks rise on faster economic growth despite Nvidia nerves – business live 3.04pm BST Closing summary: Wall Street gains as stronger GDP figures overshadow Nvidia The US economy performed better than expected in the second quarter, helping GDP to grow faster than first thought. The annualised rate of growth for the second quarter, at 3% rather than the 2.8% seen in the first reading, does not suggest an economy that is on the brink". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: US stocks rise on faster economic growth despite Nvidia nerves – business live 3.04pm BST Closing summary: Wall Street gains as stronger GDP figures overshadow Nvidia The US economy performed better than expected in the second quarter, helping GDP to grow faster than first thought. The annualised rate of growth for the second quarter, at 3% rather than the 2.8% seen in the first reading, does not suggest an economy that is on the brink
